intro: Eschweileria sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian sandwicensis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a single trunk and large, broad leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
